events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their car at an intersection and filed the initial claim.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after verifying the keywords related to vehicle collision and damage.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the case and initiate further communications.
The customer received an acknowledgement of the claim from the insurer, ensuring the process has begun.
The insurance company requested photos of the damaged car and a police report related to the accident.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including accident photos and the official police report.
The claims department began investigating the details of the collision and vehicle damage reported.
Investigation concluded that the accident was covered under policy terms with no discrepancies.
A settlement amount for the car repairs was proposed to the customer for review and approval.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement amount and the handling of the claim.
The insurance company formally approved the claim based on the settled agreement with the customer.
Payment for the approved claim amount was processed and issued to the customerâ€™s bank account.
The claim was officially closed after successful payment and confirmation that the issue was resolved.
